result.execSummary:
The defendant Vertin M. Endresen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.***NO THC***  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
P&P to notify the court in writing upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.  ***Leaving condition of contact w/ victim up to the agent, but, if those conditions or any new issues w/ victim arises, agent to notify the Court.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Bub.  Clerk. M.Burke.  DE pleads guilty. Court finds DE guilty. Court withholds sentence and palces DE on  probation with conditions; credit for 2 days served if revoked. DE to pay $100 DV surcharge. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DV surcharge.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Bub.   Clerk. M.Burke.   State in victim rights compliance. An offter has been made. Atty Bub asks for a little more time before a ludwig hearing. HE set to 07/21/22 at 8:30.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Bub.   Clerk. M.Burke.  State in victim rights compliance. STC set to 06/29/22 at 8:30.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Bub. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Bub states the case is not resolved, is waiting on addiitonal discovery from Jt Services. PTC set for 5/19/22 at 9:30am. Bond continued.

Defendant, Vertin M. Endresen, appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Attorney Jazmin Itzel Ramirez Bailon appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Bub moves to dismisses complaint for lack of probable cause;  arguments heard.  State will amend the complaint; no objection by the DE.   Amended complaint acknowledged and received.   Motion to dismiss is withdrawn by DE.     DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; State orally amends information to corrected date in amended complaint; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered to orally amended information.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
